alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:13PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw, western Washington, Wayne and northern Greene Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 512 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms scattered along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Waynesboro to 8 miles east of Waynesboro to 4 miles southwest of Chatom. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Chatom, Clara, Tibbie, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas and Fruitdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
